availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Linus Fuller (Grayson County, Kentucky, farm laborer and pvt, corp, 1st sgt, 1st lieut17th Ky InfUSA)

body.p: Grayson County, Kentucky, farm laborer and soldier. Pennsylvania native. Son of Harrison Fuller and Mary Fuller. Resident of Grayson County in 1850. Farm laborer in Grayson County in 1860. Served in the 17th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private, corporal, first sergeant, and first lieutenant from January 4, 1862, to January 23, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, p. 52B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, p. 397.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 301.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Kentucky, Application #1,209,693, Certificate #941,675.
"Missouri Death Certificates, 1910 - 1969,"_ Missouri Secretary of State, Missouri State Library, File #26352, https://www.sos.mo.gov/images/archives/deathcerts/1923/192300029707.PDF (accessed February 26, 2021).
_Find A Grave, "Linus A. Fuller (1842-1923)," Memorial #56048874, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/56048874 (accessed November 29, 2020).
